author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
Eggs have always been an affordable and abundant source of high-quality protein and other essential nutrients. That’s why World Egg Day was established in 1996. It is celebrated across the globe on the second Friday of every October.

What is World Egg Day?
World Egg Day is a day we can all appreciate how wonderful eggs are in feeding people from all walks of life. Egg farmers throughout the United States and from all over the world are able to celebrate a shared commitment to feeding the hungry and caring for the amazing animals that produce this delicious and renewable food source.

At Chino Valley Ranchers, we especially love World Egg Day, though what it represents are the things we celebrate every single day. From providing our chickens with only the highest-quality, nutrient-rich and all-organic feed to producing specialized egg products with vitamins and nutrients known to enhance human health, our company is committed to making a positive difference in the world—one egg at a time.

The World’s Most Versatile Food
What’s so great about eggs is that they are a staple food in just about every society across the globe. Every culture has egg recipes. We use eggs for so many different dishes in America, whether it’s omelets, scrambled eggs, sunny side up, baked goods and all sorts of other recipes we eat every day.

Other cultures in the world may use eggs for frittatas, huevos rancheros, egg foo yung, pancakes, crepes, waffles, blintzes, egg rolls and egg flower soup. The possibilities with eggs are truly endless, which is why they are one of the world’s most popular sources of nutrition. Just think about how many times a week you eat something that contains eggs or features eggs as the primary ingredient. Then, realize there are billions of people in the world that love eggs just as much as you. This is what World Egg Day is all about.
